title: Trial for Former Goldman Sachs Banker Set to Begin
sub_head: Roger Ng is the first defendant in the 1MDB case to face a U.S. jury
body:
A former Goldman Sachs Group Inc. managing director is set to go on trial Monday on charges related to the multibillion-dollar looting of a Malaysian government fund, bringing renewed scrutiny to the Wall Street institutionâ€™s role in the international scandal.
The banker, Roger Ng, is the first criminal defendant in the U.S. case to face a jury. The trial, in a New York federal court, is expected to offer a look at the measures Goldman employees took to reel in lucrative deals with 1Malaysia Development Berhad, a state-controlled economic development company known as 1MDB.
